articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. consumer spending rose moderately in October, while the annual increase in inflation was the smallest since early 2021, signs of cooling demand that could further strengthen expectations that the Federal Reserve's interest rate hiking campaign was over.
articles.title: US consumer spending slows in October; weekly jobless claims rise slightly

articles.author: Chavi Mehta
articles.description: More advertisers are likely to flee Elon Musk's social media platform X after the billionaire lashed out at some of the biggest names in the media industry at a New York Times DealBook event for dropping out of the platform, analysts said on Thursday.
articles.title: Analysts predict more brands will flee X after Musk tirade

articles.author: Svea Herbst-Bayliss, Dawn Chmielewski, Samrhitha A
articles.description: Activist investor Nelson Peltz is pushing ahead with plans to seek at least three board seats at Disney (DIS.N) as the firm is not satisfied with Disney CEO Bob Iger's changes, several people familiar with the matter said.
articles.title: Nelson Peltz's Trian to seek at least three Disney board seats, sources say

articles.author: Chibuike Oguh
articles.description: Salesforce Inc's (CRM.N) stock jumped by about 10% on Thursday to a nearly two-year high after the U.S. cloud and business software company reported stellar third quarter results underpinned by strong demand for its services.
articles.title: Salesforce shares jump as strong cloud demand drives stellar results

articles.author: Alex Lawler, Olesya Astakhova, Maha Dahan
articles.description: The OPEC+ alliance of oil producers will consider additional production cuts for next year to support crude prices in virtual meetings on Thursday, three delegates told Reuters.
articles.title: OPEC+ ministers meet to discuss additional oil output cuts

articles.author: Sinead Cruise
articles.description: Trading app operator Robinhood Markets Inc. (HOOD.O) said on Thursday it would roll out brokerage services in Britain, as part of an international expansion plan to "democratise finance" and increase access to markets.
articles.title: Robinhood opens in UK with low-cost US trading to woo clients

articles.author: Ann Saphir, Michael Derby
articles.description: Federal Reserve policymakers signaled on Thursday the U.S. central bank's interest rate hikes are likely over, but held the door open to further monetary policy tightening should progress on inflation stall, and pushed back on market expectations that there will be a quick pivot to rate cuts.
articles.title: As inflation cools, Fed officials signal rate hikes likely done

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: Rape is widespread amid the war in Sudan. Young women from the ethnic-African Masalit tribe describe being sexually assaulted by RSF and Arab militia forces.
articles.title: Sudanese women describe being gang-raped in attacks by Arab forces

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem, Emily Rose
articles.description: International pressure grew on Israel and Hamas to extend a truce on Thursday after another exchange of hostages for Palestinian prisoners and humanitarian aid was delivered to the besieged Gaza Strip.
articles.title: Talks intensify to extend Israel-Hamas truce after more hostages, prisoners freed

articles.author: Shristi A, Amruta Khandekar
articles.description: The Dow Jones industrials index hit its highest level in 2023 on Thursday, as Salesforce jumped on an upbeat profit forecast and a new report offered further evidence of easing inflation.
articles.title: Dow hits 2023 peak as Salesforce jumps, inflation eases
